sub_title: Incoming PhD student at the TUM/Helmholtz | MSc Data Science at TU/e | Molecular Machine Learning
summary:
👋🏼 I'm a highly motivated and enthousiastic student that enjoys working on artificial intelligence solutions that benefit the greater good of society. My ambition is to research and develop these technologies that have the potential to change the world for the better, and become an interdisciplinary researcher in the field of artificial intelligence. 

☕ Next to doing my studies full-time, I have committed myself to a wide and diverse range of extracurriculars - from teaching French to young pupils to assisting with the organization of AI-related symposia -- I don't tend to shy away from any challenge that comes up my way. Outside of work, I tend to recharge by road cycling, running, or brewing new speciality coffees and teas.

📚  A common thread that is visible in my work is the passion and intrinsic motivation to contribute to the greater good. I enjoy writing programs that could make things easier for people, and to do that responsibly on a grand scale, such that it could benefit people with e.g. their health, is one of my noble goals.  I am especially interested in explainable AI, geometric deep learning and safe/trusted AI in the context of (bio)medicine and healthcare.

🎓 I'm expecting to graduate in Summer 2023, so I'll be open for PhD/full-time opportunities by that time! At the moment, I'm busy with my MSc thesis studying the use of generative modelling within the field of hit-to-lead optimization of small therapeutic molecules.

📩 I'm always open to exchanging thoughts, whether it's on finding the best (matcha) latte in Eindhoven or on something you would like to share -- I'm always eager to listen! Do not hesitate to drop me a line (or any other geometric shape), I don't byte! :)

awards.title: ML Safety Student Scholarship ($2000)
awards.description: Received a research stipend for AI Safety research in the SPAR Program at UC Berkeley.

awards.description: Received a partial scholarship to attend the third edition of the Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School in Thessaloniki, Greece.

awards.title: Young Professional Award Nominee
awards.description: Selected to be one of the top-5 nominees of the Young Professional category of the Women in AI NL awards, noteworthy of being the only MSc student among PhD students and data scientists.

awards.title: Digital Talent Award Nominee
awards.description: Selected to be one of the Top 10 Digital Talents in the Netherlands (via Computable and RightBrains) in the digital space. Noteworthy of being the only student in the list among several managers, senior and executives in data science in the Netherlands.

awards.title: Future Women in Tech Scholarship 2022 (£4210)
awards.description: One of the five selected global delegates (acceptance rate <1%) who received a fully-funded scholarship to attend the 2022 edition of the One Young World conference in Manchester, United Kingdom.

awards.title: Synapse Scholarship (€900)
awards.description: One of the fifty European recipients that received a fully-funded scholarship to attend the inaugural edition of the Synapse AI Symposium in Milan, Italy.

awards.title: TEDxAmsterdamWomen 2022 finalist
awards.description: One of the 20 selected candidates (out of 80+ candidates) for the 2022 TEDxAmsterdamWomen Talent Night. Received TEDx-style coaching on presentation skills by an experienced TEDx-coach.

awards.title: TNW T500 2022 & 2023
awards.description: Selected to be part of the T500, which is a shortlist of 500 people in the Netherlands under the age of 26 who have shown outstanding accomplishments in the digital tech space.

projects.title: SDG-Challenge 2020
projects.description:
The mission of the SDG-Challenge is to inspire and mobilize students and companies to work together on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the United Nations. Together with five enthousiastic and motivated students from Radboud University from different study backgrounds, we formed a student consultant team. We explored how ABN AMRO can encourage companies to acquire and use knowledge to make the transition towards a more circular business model. 

We came up with the idea of RoundAbout - an 'educational Netflix' platform that uses blended learning methods to stimulate the circular knowledge economy. We ended up in the top 3 of this challenge, out of 15 universities in the Netherlands.

profile_positions.description: • Incoming PhD student at the TUM/Helmholtz, in the lab of prof. dr. Fabian Theis.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Candidate

profile_positions.description: • Head Teaching Assistant, where I will be developing assignments for BSc Biomedical Engineering students. Additionally, I will be responsible for leading the seminar sessions, while also grading and providing feedback to students, fostering a supportive and inclusive learning environment.
profile_positions.title: Head Teaching Assistant Advanced Programming and Biomedical Data Analysis

profile_positions.description:
• Part of the highly selective talent incubator (4% acceptance rate), which focused on technology and business innovation.
• Worked on a computer vision project that significantly contributed to the visibility of the Net Zero roadmap of one of the largest Dutch breweries, developed a full-stack proof-of-concept in Python and Flask and deployed it on IBM Cloud.
profile_positions.title: Extreme Blue Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Provided suggestions for research questions and identified potential sources of data to strengthen a proposal on the concept of expertise in the platform society and its operationalization.
• Contributed to a project on the automatic classification of the Dutch online antisemitic discourse using benchmark methods and (large) language models, resulted in a publication.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Taught the weekly seminars of the Data Mining course at the MSc Applied Data Science, for a group of ~25 students.
• Assisted with the with the grading of the 90+ take-home exams.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Data Mining

profile_positions.description:
• Developed an automatic processing pipeline in Python and Streamlit using natural language processing as well as novel OCR techniques to analyze unstructured financial and legal documents.
• Our proof-of-concept, which covered 57% of the 16K available documents gave us an accuracy of 88% compared to the ground truth metadata, resulting in an estimated annual savings of 2000 manual labour hours.
profile_positions.title: Data Science Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Researched on how to automate the onboarding and preprocessing flow of different datasets using AutoML methods.
• Identified novel datasets and developed a procedure in Python for automatically uploading 80+ datasets to OpenML, which is an open-source ecosystem for machine learning experiments.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant OpenML

profile_positions.description:
• Taught the workgroups of the Signal Processing course from the BSc Artificial Intelligence, responsible for the weekly assignment grading, supervising and organization of ~110 penultimate bachelor students for this course. 
• Assisted with the with the grading of the 100+ exams.
profile_positions.title: Head Teaching Assistant Signal Processing

profile_positions.description:
• Developed a demo in Python, featuring a group of four Anki Vector robots working together to navigate a dynamic maze and locate specific coloured cubes, using collective exploration and localization techniques.
• Worked on synchronizing the robots' movements and actions to work together as a group.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant EAISI

profile_positions.description:
• Part of the inaugural board (2019-2020) of the FruitPunch AI foundation.
• Responsible for managing the local AI for Good community (~200 people) by organizing educative events, maintaining relationships with external partners and assisting in the recruitment and retainment of current and prospective members.
profile_positions.title: HR & Community Officer

profile_positions.description: • Contributed to in the SignEEG project, by coding and transcribing observational and experimental data through ELAN.
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: •  The FD Student Panel is a collaboration between the FD and the Veerstichting, the student organization that has been committed since 1979 to promoting the intergenerational dialogue. The students respond to a statement related to the news, the opinion editors of the FD make a selection from it.

• Selected to participate in an highly selective interactive program that explored the importance of women in leadership and consisted of workshops to develop leadership, confidence and effective communication skills.

• Volunteer within the HartslagNu network, which is a Dutch CPR call system. In the event of a cardiac arrest in my area, I will receive a call/text message on my phone from HartslagNu to start CPR or to fetch the nearest AED.

• Curator of the bi-weekly research newsletter that has achieved a remarkable organic growth of over 300+ subscribers, representing a 40.6% increase in the subscriber base since I took over as curator.
• Implemented effective outreach efforts, including social media promotions, to increase visibility and engagement with the newsletter's content.

• Part of Dutchess Capital, which is an all-female immersive investment program, consisting of a select group of young professionals and ambitious students. Members develop top quality finance and investment decision-making skills and learn how to express their view on the financial markets.
• Topics that are covered include corporate finance and fundraising, M&A, as well as investment analysis (strategic, financial, and risk analysis) covering private equity, venture capital, and public stocks. The program also involves pitching potential investments to the fellow members, which requires keeping up to date with relevant developments, due diligences, as well as the convincing of fellow members to get on board. The program is supported by industry partners Optiver, ABN AMRO, HAL Investments, and more.

• Nova is the global by-invitation-only top-talent network that connects high potential individuals amongst themselves and with the best professional opportunities. Nova has the global community of the top ~3% high potential individuals from different domains, where more than 90% of these individuals are professionals.

• As of September 2022, I have become a One Young World Ambassador. The One Young World Community, consisting of 13.700+ young leaders worldwide has been described as the most impactful global network, as they all share the motivation to accelerate existing initiatives or establish new social ventures. The acceptance rate to become a global delegate for the conference, and subsequently an ambassador is <1%, as places for the conference and community are highly sought after.

• As SDG Voice, I bear the responsibility to 1) inform, 2) inspire and 3) stimulate companies and organizations to contribute to the Sustainable Development Goals. I do so by giving interactive workshops, presentations and trainings about the SDGs.

Notable events: Jury Member of the SDG Pluim on SDG Action Day at the KIT Royal Tropical Institute in Amsterdam, SDG Voice Trainer, SDG NL x Enactus - National Exposition

volunteer_experiences.role: 2022 Winning Women in Investment Banking participant
volunteer_experiences.description: • Selected to join the Winning Women in Investment Banking Program in London (with a 6% acceptance rate), where I learned about the firm's opportunities within the Corporate & Investment Banking division, shadowed and gained insight from female leaders.

• Received mentorship from (senior) industry and academic experts at PwC, ASML, Sanofi, and TU Delft. 
• As a result of this mentorship, I have gained invaluable insights and tools to help me thrive in my career, including a deep understanding of industry-specific trends and best practices, enhanced critical thinking and problem-solving skills, and a greater ability to adapt to changing environments and technologies.

• RightBrains’ mission is to grow the number of women in digital-focused roles. Why? Because we believe it creates an opportunity for innovation and success. In my role as an ambassador, I want to play my part to help close the digital talent gap and increase gender diversity.

• The Young Ladies Business Academy (YLBA) is a Dutch initiative for ambitious women who are interested in entrepreneurship and top positions in business. I was selected to participate in the 6th edition of the Academy, which took place between 23-27 November 2020.

• I volunteered at the ACM FAccT 2021 conference, in which I was a facilitator for the workshop on participatory methods in AI. I was responsible for guiding a group of ~15 students through an interactive CRAFT workshop.

• Worked as a  project member of the (UNI)MINDS team, of which our goal is to raise more awareness on the mental health of students at Radboud University. Whilst working on this project, I was taught how to start a social startup from its foundations and learning business fundamentals. I performed market analyses, programmed its website, and thought about how we could improve our marketing/branding strategy.

• General member of the symposium and activity committee, in which we organized a number of events to stimulate a sustainable lifestyle. Unfortunately, due to the COVID-19 virus, the symposium was canceled.

• I guided high school students who are interested in studying Artificial Intelligence. They got to experience how it is like to be a student for a day, by following several lectures, workgroups and practicals.

• Each year, the members of the SymCo try to find speakers for the yearly AI symposium, ACAIS. ACAIS is a symposium organized by Artificial Intelligence students, and is aimed at students. The theme of the 2018 edition was AI & Language.
